locations.title: East Side Theater
locations.description: Welcome to the Fairgrounds neighborhood circa 1955. You can learn more here at the East Side Theater.
locations.html:
The East Side Theater and its neighboring commercial development was the dream of George Richardson and J.W. Sanford, Sr.

The Fairgrounds neighborhood had the approximate borders of NE 8th Street on the north to the Rock Island railroad tracks at the south.

images.caption: The East Side Theater at 720-722 Bath Avenue

locations.title: Domino Parlor
locations.description: This location, 714 Bath Ave, was a variety of domino parlors. Like pool halls, domino was a dominant form of leisure in the twentieth century, particularly for men.
locations.html: This room of the model was informed by actual interior photos of the building shown here.

locations.title: Melody Records
locations.description: Melody Records - Your source for the latest hits and classic tunes!
locations.html: Melody Records was the heart of the music scene in the Fairgrounds neighborhood, featuring the latest R&B, Jazz, and Gospel recordings.
